fields.description:
TestFcLocalFsPermission has been recently migrated to Junit 5. However, its superclass FileContextPermissionBase uses Junit 4, which causes the class initializerers (BeforeAll/BeforeClass) not to be called in certain circumstances.

Migrate FileContextPermissionBase and its children fully to Junit 5.

comments.body:
stoty opened a new pull request, #7630:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7630

   ### Description of PR
   
   Make sure that FileContextPermissionBase and its childer are all migrated to Junit 5.
   
   ### How was this patch tested?
   
   Ran the children on my JDK24 + Surefire 3.5.3 branch
   
   ### For code changes:
   
   - [X] Does the title or this PR starts with the corresponding JIRA issue id (e.g. 'HADOOP-17799. Your PR title ...')?
   - [ ] Object storage: have the integration tests been executed and the endpoint declared according to the connector-specific documentation?
   - [ ] If adding new dependencies to the code, are these dependencies licensed in a way that is compatible for inclusion under [ASF 2.0](http://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#category-a)?
   - [ ] If applicable, have you updated the `LICENSE`, `LICENSE-binary`, `NOTICE-binary` files?
[~stoty]  I am responsible for handling the upgrade from Junit4 to Junit5. Currently, some parts of Hadoop-common have not been fully upgraded due to its complex dependencies.

stoty commented on PR #7630:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7630#issuecomment-2813311285

   Thanks @slfan1989 , the HDFS test has already been converted to Junit5 (that's what's broken it) , so there is no need to touch that.
   
   We have the same problem with ViewFileSystemBaseTest, which causes a lot of similar failures.
   This is breaking my Java 24 + Surefire 3.5.3 tests, I'm not sure if those even run correctly now on trunk, or if the old Surefire just swallows these errors.
   
   Should I provide a similar patch for ViewFileSystemBaseTest ?

stoty commented on PR #7630:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7630#issuecomment-2813322723

   Basically having a Junit5 test extending a Junit4 test will break the @Before*/@After* methods, at least with the latest Junit that I'm using to fix other test issues.

URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7630#issuecomment-2814202868

   > Thanks @slfan1989 , the HDFS test has already been converted to Junit5 (that's what's broken it) , so there is no need to touch that.
   > 
   > We have the same problem with **ViewFileSystemBaseTest**, which causes a lot of similar failures. This is breaking my Java 24 + Surefire 3.5.3 tests, I'm not sure if those even run correctly now on trunk, or if the old Surefire just swallows these errors.
   > 
   > Should I provide a similar patch for ViewFileSystemBaseTest ?
   
   @stoty Thank you for your contribution! You can submit a fix PR for ViewFileSystemBaseTest, and I will continue to push forward the overall upgrade of other modules.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved
